text: Jean-Luc Reitzer (born December 29, 1951 in Altkirch) is a French politician of the Republicans who has been serving as a member of the National Assembly of France since 1988,Matthieu Protard and Elizabeth Pineau (October 13, 2020), French MP gets ovation on first day back after COVID coma Reuters. representing the 3rd constituency of the Haut-Rhin department. In parliament, Reitzer serves on the Committee on Foreign Affairs. In addition to his committee assignments, he is a member of the French-Bahrain Parliamentary Friendship Group, the French-Djibouti Parliamentary Friendship Group, and the French-Turkish Parliamentary Friendship Group.Jean-Luc Reitzer French National Assembly. He served as conseiller départemental of Haut-Rhin from 1979 to 2002, and as Mayor of Altkirch from 1983 to 2017. Reitzer was tested positive for COVID-19 on 5 March 2020. He subsequently spent two and a half months in hospital being treated for the effects of the virus.Matthieu Protard and Elizabeth Pineau (October 13, 2020), French MP gets ovation on first day back after COVID coma Reuters. ==References== Category:1951 births Category:Living people Category:People from Altkirch Category:Rally for the Republic politicians Category:Union for a Popular Movement politicians Category:The Republicans (France) politicians Category:Gaullism, a way forward for France Category:Mayors of places in Grand Est Category:Deputies of the 12th National Assembly of the French Fifth Republic Category:Deputies of the 13th National Assembly of the French Fifth Republic Category:Deputies of the 14th National Assembly of the French Fifth Republic Category:Deputies of the 15th National Assembly of the French Fifth Republic
title: Jean-Luc Reitzer
